column4: First i solve "error 18: selected cylinder exceeds maximum supported by bios" on my existing system, than i could use "ide=nodma" and MAYBE my system will work then like before...
How to say "Hey grub, please install yourselv to /dev/hda1 witch should be mounted to /boot while starting"
you want grub in a partition? What boot loader are you going to put in the master boot record?
grub
so you want to use MBR grub to chainload another grub in the partition?
no -.-
you want a bog-standard setup where grub goes to the MBR and boots a system with a separate boot partition?
scrool up and read what i have written before, than you will understand
no, I don't understand your problem from what you've written before, otherwise I wouldn't be asking.
Errors: 1) DMA Fails - 2) Want to disable via pci=nodma - 3) get Error 18, to solve kernel must be at the beginning of my HDD - 4) for this i had to move /boot
are you running off a live CD at the moment?
no, old system sill works, but with damn lags and "I/O Wait" at 100%
so you've booted the old system where /boot is on the /root partition
okay, we have to take a little detour and copy your kernels and grub files to the new /boot. Run 'sudo umount /boot' to start
jeps, on /dev/hda7
can you do a 'mount /dev/hda1 /boot' and tell me what 'df -h /boot' says
I mean sudo mount of course
/dev/hda1 1020M 34M... 4% used, mounted to /boot
good, it's mounted alright then. Is /boot/grub/ populated?
dont realy understand you, but /boot is empty (just lost+found)
then 'sudo mount /dev/hda1 /mnt'
